text: Magnolia cararensis is a species of flowering plant in the family Magnoliaceae. It is endemic to Colombia, where it is known from a single location. This area is vulnerable to clearing for agriculture and the trees are cut for wood.Calderon, E., Cogollo, A., Velasquez-Rua, C., Serna-Gonzalez, M. & Garcia, N. 2014. Magnolia cararensis. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2014. Downloaded on 08 October 2015. ==References== cararensis Category:Endemic flora of Colombia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
